section.section: The Ethics Commission consists of five members.

The Governor shall appoint:
with the advice and consent of the Senate, three members, at least one of whom shall be a member of the principal political party of which the Governor is not a member;
one member nominated by the President of the Senate; and
one member nominated by the Speaker of the House.
The Governor may reject a nominee of the President or of the Speaker only for cause.
If the Governor rejects a nominee under paragraph (3) of this subsection, the appropriate presiding officer shall nominate another individual.
A vacancy shall be filled in a manner consistent with this subsection.

text.section:
A member of the Ethics Commission may not:
hold elected or appointed office in, be an employee of, or be a candidate for office in:
the federal government;
this State's government;
a municipal corporation, county, or multicounty agency of the State; or
a political party; or
be a regulated lobbyist.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Ethics Commission shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 5 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms in effect for members of the Commission on October 1, 1995.
A member may serve no more than two consecutive 5-year terms.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves for the rest of the term.
At the end of a term, a member may continue to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

Before removing a member, the Governor shall give the member:
written notice of the charges; and
an opportunity to reply to the charges.
